intro: Oxypetalum boudetii, commonly known as the Boudet's oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
